milestones.name: Open the Data Layer
milestones.description: Making SMART's intelligence accessible to partners and FIs

quarters.why: Partners need APIs to access and contribute trait data. Quality audit ensures reliability before opening the platform.
shipping: Set Traits API v1 - Partners can set user traits via API
Trait Quality Audit - Audit all 450 existing traits, categorize issues
Model-Based Trait Documentation - Whitepapers explaining data derivation
dependencies: Adapters team: Upstream data quality fixes
outcomes: 2 partners actively contributing traits
Trait quality audit complete with remediation roadmap

quarters.why: Decision point on next API based on partner feedback. Metadata model enables clear partner attribution in UI.
shipping: Set Audiences API OR Get Traits API - Based on March decision and team capacity
Trait Metadata Model - Namespace/source fields for partner attribution
dependencies: Design team: UI/UX for partner trait visualization
outcomes: 3-5 partners contributing traits
2-3 FIs with measurable campaign outcomes using partner data

quarters.why: Real-time monitoring ensures platform reliability at scale. Essential for partner trust and FI confidence.
shipping: Trait Observability/Monitoring - Real-time computation monitoring, quality metrics, alerting
outcomes: Trait quality metrics tracked in real-time
Partner trait contribution visibility

milestones.name: Enable Native Experiences
milestones.description: Partners building rich, integrated experiences in digital banking

quarters.why: Partners need safe testing environment before production integrations. Foundation for all SDK work.
shipping: Partner Dev Environment - SDK dev environment for testing against dev API endpoints
outcomes: Partner dev environment available for testing
SDK enhancement requirements collected from partners

quarters.why: Current SDK too restrictive for partner needs (Account Tiles limited to HADEs). Flexible layouts unlock richer experiences.
shipping: SDK Enhancements - Flexible layout configurations beyond HADEs
FDIC Disclaimer Support - Legal requirement for financial product tiles
New Component Types - Beyond Account Tiles for diverse use cases
dependencies: Digital banking platform team: New UI pattern support
outcomes: Partners can build flexible Account Tile layouts
FDIC disclaimers and custom CTAs supported

quarters.why: Partner traits and audiences need clear visibility in SMART UI. Low-hanging fruit improvements support new data sources.
shipping: Partner Trait Attribution - Show source/namespace in UI
Filtering by Source - Group and filter traits by data source
Partner Audience Visibility - Display partner-contributed audiences
partners: All integrated partners benefit from better UI
outcomes: Clear distinction between Q2 and partner traits
FIs can easily discover and use partner data

milestones.name: Connect External Tools
milestones.description: FIs using their existing martech stack with digital banking

quarters.why: Need to validate connector choice with FIs and understand integration patterns before building.
dependencies: Partnership team: FI conversations about martech usage
outcomes: MarTech connector requirements gathered from FI conversations
HubSpot validated as first connector choice

quarters.why: Co-create with FI to ensure connector meets real needs. Finalize requirements before Q3 build.
dependencies: Customer success: Identify and engage design partner FI
outcomes: Design partner FI committed to HubSpot connector pilot
Detailed requirements finalized

quarters.why: 15% of FIs don't use SMART due to existing tools. Connector removes this barrier and expands addressable market.
shipping: HubSpot Connector v1 - Bidirectional sync (segments to SMART, traits to HubSpot)
dependencies: Customer success: FI onboarding and training
outcomes: 1 FI using connector in production
Segment sync working bidirectionally
Validation for future connector roadmap

milestones.name: Developer Experience
milestones.description: Making integration effortless for partners and FIs

quarters.why: Partners need basic docs and testing capability immediately. Foundation for all enablement work.
shipping: Partner Dev Environment - Testing against dev API endpoints
Initial API Documentation - Getting started guides
outcomes: Partners can test integrations safely
Basic documentation available

quarters.why: FIs need to test SMART in their permanent test environments. Critical for enterprise adoption.
shipping: PTE Testing Capability - Initial implementation (research in Q1 informs approach)
dependencies: Digital banking platform team: PTE infrastructure
outcomes: FIs can test SMART in PTE
Clear path for production rollout

quarters.why: Support burden increases with partner growth. Self-serve portal scales enablement and reduces friction.
shipping: Partner Developer Portal v1 - Comprehensive guides, tutorials, API docs, code examples
outcomes: Partners can onboard with minimal support
Support ticket volume decreases
Time-to-integrate reduces to <30 days
